intro: Fittingia headsiana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in a wide range of colors, typically in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are velvety and heart-shaped, often with a waxy texture. Fittingia headsiana thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
